text: What is the difference between a shader and a material?

options.text: A shader is a script that runs as part of the rendering process, and a material is an asset that specifies properties to a shader.
A shader is used in physically-based rendering to create photorealistic effects, and a material is used to increase performance if photorealism is not necessary.
A shader affects how light appears on an object, and a material affects its color.
They are actually the same thing.

feedbackCorrect: Shaders and materials work together to define all the characteristics of a mesh surface during the rendering process. A material is an asset that works with a shader to define how meshes will be rendered.
